title: Ticket #1389: StringList's similar() fails when the StringLists are the same length
description:
similar() in StringList.cpp returns true when called on two dissimilar StringLists of equal length. 

StringList sl("a;b;c", ";");
StringList other("d;e;f", ";");
bool retVal = sl.similar(other, true);

similar() incorrectly returns true instead of false.

The unit test output: 

TEST:  Does similar() return false when the two StringLists are not similar, but co
ntain the same number of strings?
INPUT:
    StringList:  a,b,c
    StringList:  d,e,f
    ANYCASE:  TRUE
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  FALSE
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  TRUE
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 4007
check_ins: 2010-May-04 15:39   Check-in [17937]: Removed similar() from StringList and the unit tests for StringList. It isn't used anywhere else within condor. (#1389 #1239) (By Josh Slauson )
creator: slauson
